Create list parser specification

Source: R/lcols.R
lcols.Rd

Create list parser specification

lcols(..., .default = zap())

Arguments

...

Column specification objects created by lcol_*().
.default

Deprecated.

Examples

lcols(
  id = lcol_int("id"),
  name = lcol_chr("name"),
  aliases = lcol_lst_of("aliases", character())
)

#> Warning: `lcols()` was deprecated in tibblify 0.2.0.
#> Please use `spec_df()` instead.
#> Warning: `lcol_int()` was deprecated in tibblify 0.2.0.
#> Please use `tib_int()` instead.
#> Warning: `lcol_chr()` was deprecated in tibblify 0.2.0.
#> Please use `tib_chr()` instead.
#> Warning: `lcol_lst_of()` was deprecated in tibblify 0.2.0.
#> Please use `tib_vector()` instead.
#> spec_df(
#>   id = tib_int("id"),
#>   name = tib_chr("name"),
#>   aliases = tib_chr_vec("aliases")
#> )

# To create multiple columns of the same type use the bang-bang-bang (!!!)
# operator together with `purrr::map()`
int_cols <- purrr::set_names(c("id", "age"))
chr_cols <- purrr::set_names(c("name", "title"))

lcols(
  !!!purrr::map(int_cols, lcol_int),
  !!!purrr::map(chr_cols, lcol_chr)
)

#> spec_df(
#>   id = tib_int("id"),
#>   age = tib_int("age"),
#>   name = tib_chr("name"),
#>   title = tib_chr("title")
#> )
